verses.kjv: In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah came Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon unto Jerusalem, and besieged it.
verses.web: In the third year of the reign of Jehoiakim king of Judah Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came to Jerusalem and besieged it.
verses.ct: During the 3rd year of King Jehoiakim's reign over Judah, King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon marched his army to Jerusalem and laid siege to the city.

verses.kjv: And the Lord gave Jehoiakim king of Judah into his hand, with part of the vessels of the house of God: which he carried into the land of Shinar to the house of his god; and he brought the vessels into the treasure house of his god.
verses.web: The Lord gave Jehoiakim king of Judah into his hand, with part of the vessels of the house of God; and he carried them into the land of Shinar to the house of his god. He brought the vessels into the treasure house of his god.
verses.ct: The Lord handed King Jehoiakim over to Nebuchadnezzar, along with some of the sacred vessels from the house of God. Nebuchadnezzar carried them back to the land of Shinar and placed the vessels in the treasure house of his own god.

verses.kjv: And the king spake unto Ashpenaz the master of his eunuchs, that he should bring certain of the children of Israel, and of the king’s seed, and of the princes;
verses.web: The king spoke to Ashpenaz the master of his eunuchs, that he should bring in some of the children of Israel, even of the royal offspring and of the nobles;
verses.ct: The king ordered Ashpenaz, his chief court official, to select some of the young men from Israel — specifically from the royal family and the nobility.

verses.kjv: Children in whom was no blemish, but well favoured, and skilful in all wisdom, and cunning in knowledge, and understanding science, and such as had ability in them to stand in the king’s palace, and whom they might teach the learning and the tongue of the Chaldeans.
verses.web: youths in whom was no defect, but well-favored, and skillful in all wisdom, and endowed with knowledge, and understanding science, and who had the ability to stand in the king’s palace; and that he should teach them the learning and the language of the Chaldeans.
verses.ct: They had to be young men without any physical defect, good-looking, gifted in every area of wisdom, well-educated, quick to learn, and capable of serving in the king's palace. Ashpenaz was to train them in the language and literature of the Chaldeans.

verses.kjv: And the king appointed them a daily provision of the king’s meat, and of the wine which he drank: so nourishing them three years, that at the end thereof they might stand before the king.
verses.web: The king appointed for them a daily portion of the king’s dainties, and of the wine which he drank, and that they should be nourished three years; that at its end they should stand before the king.
verses.ct: The king assigned them a daily portion of food and wine from his own table. Their training would last 3 years, and after that they would enter the king's service.

verses.kjv: Now among these were of the children of Judah, Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah:
verses.web: Now among these were of the children of Judah: Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.
verses.ct: Among those chosen were 4 young men from the tribe of Judah: Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.

verses.kjv: Unto whom the prince of the eunuchs gave names: for he gave unto Daniel the name of Belteshazzar; and to Hananiah, of Shadrach; and to Mishael, of Meshach; and to Azariah, of Abednego.
verses.web: The prince of the eunuchs gave names to them: to Daniel he gave the name Belteshazzar; to Hananiah, Shadrach; to Mishael, Meshach; and to Azariah, Abednego.
verses.ct: The chief court official gave them new Babylonian names: Daniel became Belteshazzar, Hananiah became Shadrach, Mishael became Meshach, and Azariah became Abednego.

verses.kjv: But Daniel purposed in his heart that he would not defile himself with the portion of the king’s meat, nor with the wine which he drank: therefore he requested of the prince of the eunuchs that he might not defile himself.
verses.web: But Daniel purposed in his heart that he would not defile himself with the king’s dainties, nor with the wine which he drank. Therefore he requested of the prince of the eunuchs that he might not defile himself.
verses.ct: But Daniel made up his mind that he would not defile himself by eating the king's food or drinking his wine. So he asked the chief court official for permission to avoid defiling himself.

verses.kjv: Now God had brought Daniel into favour and tender love with the prince of the eunuchs.
verses.web: Now God made Daniel find kindness and compassion in the sight of the prince of the eunuchs.
verses.ct: God had already caused the chief official to look on Daniel with kindness and compassion.

verses.kjv: And the prince of the eunuchs said unto Daniel, I fear my lord the king, who hath appointed your meat and your drink: for why should he see your faces worse liking than the children which are of your sort? then shall ye make me endanger my head to the king.
verses.web: The prince of the eunuchs said to Daniel, “I fear my lord the king, who has appointed your food and your drink. For why should he see your faces worse looking than the youths who are of your own age? Then you would endanger my head with the king.”
verses.ct: But the official told Daniel, "I'm afraid of my lord the king. He's the one who decided what you would eat and drink. If he sees that you look worse than the other young men your age, he'll have my head!"

verses.kjv: Then said Daniel to Melzar, whom the prince of the eunuchs had set over Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah,
verses.web: Then Daniel said to the steward whom the prince of the eunuchs had appointed over Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah:
verses.ct: So Daniel went to the steward whom the chief official had put in charge of him, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah.

verses.kjv: Prove thy servants, I beseech thee, ten days; and let them give us pulse to eat, and water to drink.
verses.web: “Test your servants, I beg you, ten days; and let them give us vegetables to eat, and water to drink.
verses.ct: "Please test us for 10 days," Daniel said. "Give us nothing but vegetables to eat and water to drink."

verses.kjv: Then let our countenances be looked upon before thee, and the countenance of the children that eat of the portion of the king’s meat: and as thou seest, deal with thy servants.
verses.web: Then let our faces be examined before you, and the face of the youths who eat of the king’s dainties; and as you see, deal with your servants.”
verses.ct: "Then compare how we look with the young men who eat the king's food, and decide what to do with us based on what you see."

verses.kjv: So he consented to them in this matter, and proved them ten days.
verses.web: So he listened to them in this matter, and tested them for ten days.
verses.ct: The steward agreed to the test and gave them 10 days.

verses.kjv: And at the end of ten days their countenances appeared fairer and fatter in flesh than all the children which did eat the portion of the king’s meat.
verses.web: At the end of ten days, their faces appeared fairer, and they were fatter in flesh, than all the youths who ate of the king’s dainties.
verses.ct: When the 10 days were up, Daniel and his friends looked healthier and better nourished than all the young men who had been eating the king's food.

verses.kjv: Thus Melzar took away the portion of their meat, and the wine that they should drink; and gave them pulse.
verses.web: So the steward took away their dainties, and the wine that they would drink, and gave them vegetables.
verses.ct: After that, the steward permanently removed the rich food and wine from their diet and gave them vegetables instead.

verses.kjv: As for these four children, God gave them knowledge and skill in all learning and wisdom: and Daniel had understanding in all visions and dreams.
verses.web: Now as for these four youths, God gave them knowledge and skill in all learning and wisdom; and Daniel had understanding in all visions and dreams.
verses.ct: God gave these 4 young men exceptional knowledge and skill in every area of learning and wisdom. Daniel, in particular, was given the ability to understand visions and dreams.

verses.kjv: Now at the end of the days that the king had said he should bring them in, then the prince of the eunuchs brought them in before Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.web: At the end of the days which the king had appointed for bringing them in, the prince of the eunuchs brought them in before Nebuchadnezzar.
verses.ct: When the 3-year training period the king had set was complete, the chief official brought all the young men before Nebuchadnezzar.

verses.kjv: And the king communed with them; and among them all was found none like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: therefore stood they before the king.
verses.web: The king talked with them; and among them all was found no one like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah. Therefore stood they before the king.
verses.ct: The king interviewed each of them, and no one impressed him like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah. So they were given positions in the king's court.

verses.kjv: And in all matters of wisdom and understanding, that the king enquired of them, he found them ten times better than all the magicians and astrologers that were in all his realm.
verses.web: In every matter of wisdom and understanding, concerning which the king inquired of them, he found them ten times better than all the magicians and enchanters who were in all his realm.
verses.ct: Whenever the king consulted them on any matter requiring wisdom or insight, he found them 10 times better than every magician and enchanter in his entire kingdom.

verses.kjv: And Daniel continued even unto the first year of king Cyrus.
verses.web: Daniel continued even to the first year of king Cyrus.
verses.ct: Daniel remained in service there all the way until the 1st year of King Cyrus.
